span.style: text-align: left; font-weight: 700; font-family: "Source Sans Pro"; color: rgb(42, 75, 92);

li.br:
The Town of Portsmouth has a unique virtual Veterans Honor Roll! From any internet device, you can view the Town of Portsmouth's virtual Veterans' Honor Roll. We also have a kiosk set up at Town Hall!
Thanks go to our Veterans Honor Roll Committee for their hard work on this project. If you are a Portsmouth Veteran and are interested in becoming part of the Honor Roll, contact the Town Clerk's office at (401) 683-2101 for information on how to speak to the Committee.

ol.li:
Portsmouth Gears up for COVID-19
Here's How to Stay Informed
The Town of Portsmouth, RI is invoking procedures to keep the citizens of the town informed on the local situation and actions concerning the Coronavirus (COVID-19) situation.
For information on the State and National level, citizens are directed to:
The RI Department of Health Coronavirus pages: RIDOH's COVID-19 web page https://health.ri.gov/diseases/ncov2019/)
The CDC Coronavirus Pages - Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) page (https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/index.html)
Both sites are filled with fact-based information on the best ways to prevent the spread of illness and what to do if you become sick with ANY illness.
The RIDOH Hotline for COVID-19 questions is 401-222-8022 or 211 after 4:30 PM.
The Town has posted a web page, Portsmouth-Specific Coronavirus Information, which is posted and updated often. Check back for new information at https://www.portsmouthri.com/1594/Portsmouth-Specific-Coronavirus-Informat.
The Town of Portsmouth Emergency Management Agency (PEMA) has activated its Emergency Operations Center (EOC) to coordinate Portsmouth-specific information and actions. Initially, the EOC will be operating between 7 AM to 6 PM. During operating hours, call the EOC at 401-643-0379. You can also email the EOC at COVID@portsmouthri.com.
In an Emergency Always Dial 911
Stay Informed Via Social Media
Current Portsmouth COVID-19 information is also posted at:
Facebook page @PortsmouthEmergency
Twitter feed @PortsmouthEmerg
Get Portsmouth, RI COVID-19 Twitter feeds by using hashtag #COVID02871
Visit the Town Web Site
Emergency Management Agency Blog - subscribe to Emergency Management in Notify Me® or view directly at https://www.portsmouthri.com/Blog.aspx. for a running list of events and information.
Emergency Management Agency Notifications - subscribe at Notify Me® or view alerts at https://www.portsmouthri.com/list.aspx.
Subscribe for Automatic Town Emergency Notifications
CodeRED is the Town of Portsmouth's emergency notification system
Notify Me® alert system. To subscribe, click on the links provided
You can also go to the Town's website home page and click on the appropriate big blue button for CodeRED and Notify Me®.

span.style: font-weight: 700; font-family: "Source Sans Pro"; color: rgb(42, 75, 92);

div.br: 9 AM to Noon - Portsmouth High School, 120 Education Ln

li.div: Items accepted at NO charge: Televisions, computers, laptops, monitors, routers, computer parts, cell phones, PDA’s, mice, keyboards, ink-jet printers, toner cartridges, CD/DVD players, radios, network equipment, wires, stereos, plastic speakers, telephones, cameras, microwaves, small household appliances, and acid lead batteries including auto/marine/laptop and battery back-ups.
li.p: A $10 disposal fee is charged for each laser-jet printer, wood-cased speaker ($5 for small), air conditioner, dehumidifier, and other coolant containing devices.
Not accepted: Light bulbs, single use batteries, tapes/disks, glass, cardboard, Styrofoam, broken TV tubes or any hazardous materials.
For more information see their website at www.indiecycle.com or email: indiecycle@gmail.com
